edu.cs495.engine.gfx

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cs495.engine.gfx.Renderer

  • public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    The final boss of rendering. This class handles all drawing requests for each type of AbstractRequest and acts executive of render order.
    Version:
    February 2019
    Author:
    Spencer Imbleau

    • Constructor Summary

      Initializes the renderer

      • clear

        public void clear()

      • process

        public void process(AbstractCamera camera)
        Processes and draw the game. Order > Draw Background > Draw Non-Overlay Requests > Draw Overlay Requests
        Parameters:
        -

      • setMap

        public void setMap(Image image)
        Sets the background image
        Parameters:
        image - - The background image

      • draw

        public void draw(Image image,
                 int offX,
                 int offY)
        (Draw is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an ImageRequest and add it to the list of render requests. Render requests are actually drawn to the canvas during processing.
        Parameters:
        image - - The image to draw
        offX - - The x coordinate to draw image at (from top left)
        offY - - The y coordinate to draw image at (from top left)
        See Also:
        process()

      • draw

        public void draw(Image image,
                 int renderOrder,
                 int offX,
                 int offY)
        (Draw is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an ImageRequest with a specific render order and add it to the list of render requests. Render requests are actually drawn to the canvas during processing.
        Parameters:
        image - - The image to draw
        renderOrder - - override the default render order
        offX - - The x coordinate to draw image at (from top left)
        offY - - The y coordinate to draw image at (from top left)
        See Also:
        process()

      • draw

        public void draw(SpriteSheet spriteSheet,
                 int tileX,
                 int tileY,
                 int offX,
                 int offY)
        (Draw is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an ImageRequest from a sprite and add it to the list of render requests. Render requests are actually drawn to the canvas during processing.
        Parameters:
        spriteSheet - - The sprite sheet being used
        tileX - - the X coordinate tile
        tileY - - the y coordinate tile
        offX - - the x coordinate to render at
        offY - - the y coordinate to render at
        See Also:
        process()

        offY - - the y coordinate to render at

        process()

      • draw

        public void draw(java.lang.String text,
                 Font font,
                 int argb,
                 int renderOrder,
                 int offX,
                 int offY)
        (Draw is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an ImageRequest from a string and font with a specific render order and add it to the list of render requests. Render requests are actually drawn to the canvas during processing. NOTE: This is kinda horribly inefficient remaking the font image every time, so only use this for debugging
        Parameters:
        text - - text to render
        font - - the font to render the text in
        argb - - the ARGB formatted color of the string when rendered
        renderOrder - - override the default render order
        offX - - the x coordinate to render at
        offY - - the y coordinate to render at
        See Also:
        process()

        offY - - the y coordinate to render at

      • drawOverlay

        public void drawOverlay(Image image,
                        int renderOrder,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        (DrawOverlay is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an OverlayRequest from an Image and add it to the list of OverlayRequests. Overlays are drawn during processing. are actually drawn to the canvas during processing.
        Parameters:
        image - - the image to draw
        renderOrder - - the render order of the image
        x - - x coordinate offset from the left side of the screen
        y - - y coordinate offset from the top side of the screen

      • drawOverlay

        public void drawOverlay(SpriteSheet spriteSheet,
                        int tileX,
                        int tileY,
                        int renderOrder,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        (DrawOverlay is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an OverlayRequest from a sprite and add it to the list of OverlayRequests. Overlays are drawn during processing. are actually drawn to the canvas during processing.
        Parameters:
        spriteSheet - - the sprite sheet the sprite comes from
        tileX - - the x coordinate tile in the sprite sheet
        tileY - - the y coordinate tile in the sprite sheet
        renderOrder - - the render order of the sprite
        x - - x coordinate offset from the left side of the screen
        y - - y coordinate offset from the top side of the screen

      • drawOverlay

        public void drawOverlay(Box box,
                        int renderOrder,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        (DrawOverlay is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an OverlayRequest from a box and add it to the list of OverlayRequests. Overlays are drawn during processing. are actually drawn to the canvas during processing.
        Parameters:
        box - - the box to draw
        renderOrder - - the render order of the box
        x - - x coordinate offset from the left side of the screen
        y - - y coordinate offset from the top side of the screen

      • drawOverlay

        public void drawOverlay(java.lang.String text,
                        Font font,
                        int argb,
                        int renderOrder,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        (DrawOverlay is an overloaded method and has many implementations) This draw method will create an OverlayRequest from a String and add it to the list of OverlayRequests. Overlays are drawn during processing. are actually drawn to the canvas during processing.
        Parameters:
        text - - the text to render
        font - - the font to render the text in
        argb - - the color of the font
        renderOrder - - the render order of the text
        x - - x coordinate offset from the left side of the screen
        y - - y coordinate offset from the top side of the screen

      • drawLightLine

        public void drawLightLine(Light light,
                          int x0,
                          int y0,
                          int x1,
                          int y1,
                          int offX,
                          int offY)
        (Helper Method) Draws a light ray onto the game canvas
        Parameters:
        light - - the light from which this ray is from
        x0 - - Light Line From X Position
        y0 - - Light Line From Y Position
        x1 - - Light Line To X Position
        y1 - - Light Line To Y Position
        offX - - Offset x render position
        offY - - Offset y render position

        Horrible method, ignore this. It will be replaced eventually.
